City Council

Highland Village is a Home Rule City and operates under a council-manager form of government. All members of Council are elected at-large, under a place system, and serve staggered two-year terms:

  • The Mayor (Place 1) and Council members in Places 2, 4, and 6 are elected in even-numbered years.
  • Council members in Places 3, 5, and 7 are elected in odd-numbered year.
  • No person shall serve for more than four consecutive terms on the Council, regardless of place. A term shall mean a period of time for which a Council member is elected to office, regardless of the number of days served. No person shall serve his/her full complement of successive terms more than twice during his/her lifetime.

The City Council is the legislative and governing body of the City. In accordance with City Charter, the Council enacts legislation, adopts the annual operating budget and is responsible for setting policy. The City Manager oversees the day-to-day operations of the City and implements policies set forth by the Council. 

Elected Officials

  • Charlotte Wilcox - Council Place 1 (Mayor)
    Term expires 2026
  • Jon Kixmiller - Council Place 2 
    Term expires 2026
  • Kevin Cox - Council Place 3 
    Term expires 2027
  • Shawn Nelson - Council Place 4  
    Term expires 2026  
  • Rhonda Hurst - Council Place 5
    Term expires 2027                                         
  • Robert Fiester - Council Place 6
    (Deputy Mayor Pro Tem)
    Term expires 2026 
  • Brian Fiorenza - Council Place 7 
    (Mayor Pro Tem)
    Term expires 2027

Meetings

  • *7:00 p.m. (early work sessions at *6:00 p.m.) *Always confirm start times on agenda
  • Second and fourth Tuesday of each month
  • Council Chambers at the Municipal Complex
         1000 Highland Village Rd.
         Highland Village, TX 75077
  • Individuals wishing to address the City Council must complete the Speaker’s Request Form and present it to the City Secretary prior to the start of the Regular Meeting. The Speaker's Request Form is for members of the public to provide in-person comments during Visitor's Comments, a public hearing or on any item listed on the meeting agenda.  Groups wishing to address the same issue are encouraged to select a spokesperson. 

Agendas, Minutes & Videos

Agendas for all public meetings are posted at least 72 hours prior to the start of the meeting.  Meeting agendas are posted online and on the official City bulletin board located in the lobby of the Municipal Complex.   Available agenda packets and approved minutes are also available online.  Access to live stream video during a regularly scheduled meeting, and archived videos of previous meetings, are available online.
